      static class  HostRoleCommandDAO.LastServiceCheckDTO
      A simple DTO for storing the most recent service check time for a given Role.

      • findByStatusBetweenStages

        public List<HostRoleCommandEntity> findByStatusBetweenStages(long requestId,
                                                             HostRoleStatus status,
                                                             long minStageId,
                                                             long maxStageId)
        Finds all the HostRoleCommandEntitys for the given request that are between the specified stage IDs and have the specified status.
        Parameters:
        requestId - the request ID
        status - the command status to query for (not null).
        minStageId - the lowest stage ID to requests tasks for.
        maxStageId - the highest stage ID to request tasks for.
        Returns:
        the tasks that satisfy the specified parameters.

      • findAggregateCounts

        public Map<Long,HostRoleCommandStatusSummaryDTO> findAggregateCounts(Long requestId)
        Finds the counts of tasks for a request and groups them by stage id. If caching is enabled, this will first consult the cache. Cache misses will then defer to loading the data from the database and then caching the result.
        Parameters:
        requestId - the request id
        Returns:
        the map of stage-to-summary objects

      • findMostRecentFailure

        public HostRoleCommandEntity findMostRecentFailure(Long requestId)
        During Rolling and Express Upgrade, want to bubble up the error of the most recent failure, i.e., greatest task id, assuming that there are no other completed tasks after it.
        Parameters:
        requestId - upgrade request id
        Returns:
        Most recent task failure during stack upgrade, or null if one doesn't exist.

      • updateAutomaticSkipOnFailure

        public void updateAutomaticSkipOnFailure(long requestId,
                                         boolean skipOnFailure,
                                         boolean skipOnServiceCheckFailure)
        Updates the HostRoleCommandEntity.isFailureAutoSkipped() flag for all commands for the given request.

        This will update each entity to ensure that the cache is maintained in a correct state. A batch update doesn't always reflect in JPA-managed entities.

        Stages which do not support automatically skipped commands will be updated with a value of false.

        Parameters:
        requestId - the request ID of the commands to update
        skipOnFailure - true to automatically skip failures, false otherwise.
        skipOnServiceCheckFailure - true to skip service check failures
        See Also:
        StageEntity.isAutoSkipOnFailureSupported()

      • findAll

        public List<HostRoleCommandEntity> findAll(Request request,
                                           Predicate predicate)
        Finds all HostRoleCommandEntity that match the provided predicate. This method will make JPA do the heavy lifting of providing a slice of the result set.
        Parameters:
        request -
        Returns:

      • getHostsWithPendingTasks

        public List<String> getHostsWithPendingTasks(long iLowestRequestIdInProgress,
                                             long iHighestRequestIdInProgress)
        Gets a lists of hosts with commands in progress given a range of requests. The range of requests should include all requests with at least 1 stage in progress.
        Returns:
        the list of hosts with commands in progress.
        See Also:
        HostRoleStatus.IN_PROGRESS_STATUSES

      • getBlockingHostsForRequest

        public List<String> getBlockingHostsForRequest(long lowerRequestIdInclusive,
                                               long requestId)
        Gets a lists of hosts with commands in progress which occurr before the specified request ID. This will only return commands which are not AgentCommand.AgentCommandType.BACKGROUND_EXECUTION_COMMAND as thsee commands do not block future requests.
        Parameters:
        lowerRequestIdInclusive - the lowest request ID to consider (inclusive) when getting any blocking hosts.
        requestId - the request ID to calculate any blocking hosts for (essentially, the upper limit exclusive)
        Returns:
        the list of hosts from older running requests which will block those same hosts in the specified request ID.
        See Also:
        HostRoleStatus.IN_PROGRESS_STATUSES

      • getLatestServiceChecksByRole

        public List<HostRoleCommandDAO.LastServiceCheckDTO> getLatestServiceChecksByRole(long clusterId)
        Gets the most recently run service check grouped by the command's role (which is the only way to identify the service it was for!?)
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the ID of the cluster to get the service checks for.

        public Set<Long> findTaskIdsByRequestStageIds(List<RequestDAO.StageEntityPK> requestStageIds)
